gurmukhi: Bv Bwr Apwr invwrn kO kilkI Avqwr khwvhgy ] Bl Bwg BXw ieh sMBl ky hirjU hirmMdr Awvhgy ]151]
transliteration: Bhav Bhaar Apaar Nivaaran Kau Kaliki Avtaar Kahaavahge|| Bhal Bhaag Bhayaa Eh Sanbhal Ke Har(i)joo Har(i)mandar Aavahge||151||
translation: For the removal the burden of the earth, he be called Kalki incarnation; the town of Sambhal is very fortunate, where the Lord will manifest Himself.151.

gurmukhi: BUm ko Bwr auqwr bfy bf Aws bfI Cb pwvhgy ] Kltwr juJwr birAwr hTI Gn GoKn ijau Ghrwvhgy ]
transliteration: Bhoom Ko Bhaar Outaar Bade Bad Aas Badichhab Paavahge|| Khaltaar Jujhaar Bariaar Bathi Ghan Ghokhan Jio Ghahraavahge||
translation: He will appear magnificent after removing the burden of the earth; at that time, very great warriors and persistent heroes, will thunder like clouds;

gurmukhi: kl nwrd BUq ipswc prI jYpqR Dr`qR sunwvhgy ] Bl Bwg BXw ieh sMBl ky hirjU hirmMdr Awvhgy ]152]
transliteration: Kal Naarad Bhoot Pisaach Parijaipatra Dharattra Sounaavahge|| Bhal Bhaag Bhayaa Eh Sanbhal Ke Har(i)joo Har(i)mandar Aavahge||152||
translation: Narada, ghosts, imps and fairies will sing His song of victory; the town of Sambhal is very fortunate, where the Lord will manifest Himself.152.

gurmukhi: Jwr kiRpwn juJwr bfy rx m`D mhw qb pwvhgy ] Dr lu`Q plu`Q ibQwr GxI Gn kI Gt ijau Ghrwvhgy ]
transliteration: Jhaar Kridaan Jujhaar Bade Ran Maddh Mahaa Tab Paavahge|| Dhar Loutth Paloutth Bithaar Ghanikighat Jio Ghahraavahge||
translation: He will look splendid in the battlefield after killing the great heroes with His sword; knocking down corpses upon corpses, He will thunder like clouds;

gurmukhi: cqurwnn rudR crwcr jy jX s`d nn`d sunwvhgy ] Bl Bwg BXw ieh sMBl ky hirjU hirmMdr Awvhgy ]153]
transliteration: Chaturaanan Rudra Charaachar Je Jaya Sadd Nanadd Sounaavahge|| Bhal Bhaag Bhayaa Eh Sanbhal Ke Har(i)joo Har(i)mandar Aavahge||153||
translation: Brahma, Rudra and all animate and inanimate objects will sing the declaration of His victory; the town of Sambhal is very fortunate, where the Lord will manifest Himself.153.

gurmukhi: qwr pRmwn aucwn Dujw lK dyv Adyv qRswvhgy ] klgI gjgwh gdw brCI gih pwx kiRpwx BRmwvhgy ]
transliteration: Taar Pramaan Ouchaan Dbujaa Lakh Dev Adev Trasaavahge|| Kalhigadgadb Gadaa Barchhi Gadb Paan Kridaan Bhramaavahge||
translation: Looking at His sky-reaching banner all the gods and others will become fearful; wearing His aigrette and holding his mace, lance and sword in His hands, He will move hither and thither;

gurmukhi: jg pwp sMbUh iblwsn kau klkI kil Drm clwvhgy ] Bl Bwg BXw ieh sMBl ky hirjU hirmMdr Awvhgy ]154]
transliteration: Jag Paap Sanboodhe Bilaasan Kau Kalki Kal(i) Dharam Chalaavahge|| Bhal Bhaag Bhayaa Eh Sanbhal Ke Har(i)joo Har(i)mandar Aavahge||154||
translation: He will propagate His religion in the Iron age for destroying the sins in the world; the town of Sambhal is very fortunate, where the Lord will manifest Himself.154.

gurmukhi: pwn kiRpwn Ajwn Bujw rix rUp mhwn idKwvhgy ] piRq mwn sujwn ApRmwn pRBw lK ibEm ibvwn ljwvhgy ]
transliteration: Paan Kridaanndajaan Bhujaa Ran(i) Roop Mahaan Dikhaavahge|| Pritmaan Sujaan Apramaan Prabhaa Lakh Biom Bivaan Lajaavahge||
translation: The mighty-armed Lord, taking up His sword in His hand will show His Superb Form in he battlefield and seeing His extraordinary glory, the gods will feel shy in the sky;

gurmukhi: gix BUq ipswc pryq prI iml jIq kY gIq gvwvhgy ] Bl Bwg BXw ieh sMBl ky hirjU hirmMdr Awvhgy ]155]
transliteration: Gad(i) Bhoot Pisaach Daret Pari Mil Jit Kai Geet Gadaavahge|| Bhal Bhaag Bhayaa Eh Sanbhal Ke Har(i)joo Har(i)mandar Aavahge||155||
translation: The ghosts, imps, fiends, fairies, fairies, ganas etc. will together sing the song of His victory; the town of Sambhal is very fortunate, where the Lord will manifest Himself.155.

gurmukhi: bwjq fMk AqMk smY rx rMg qurMg ncwvhgy ] kis bwn kmwn bdw brCI kir sUl qiRsUl BRmwvhgy ]
transliteration: Baajat Danak Atank Samai Ran Ran Turan Nachaavahge|| Kas(i) Baan Kamaan Gadaa Barchhi Kar(i) Sool Trisool Bhramaavahge||
translation: The trumpets will sound at the time of war and they will cause the horses to dance; they will move taking with them the bows and arrows, maces, lances, spears, tridents etc.,

gurmukhi: gx dyv Adyv ipswc prI rx dyK sBY rhswvhgy ] Bl Bwg BXw ieh sMBl ky hirjU hirmMdr Awvhgy ]156]
transliteration: Gad(i) Dev Adev Pisaach Pari Ran Dekh Sabhai Rahsaavahge|| Bhal Bhaag Bhayaa Eh Sanbhal Ke Har(i)joo Har(i)mandar Aavahge||156||
translation: And looking at them the gods, demons, imps, fairies etc. will become pleased; the town of Sambhal is very fortunate where the Lord will manifest Himself.156.

gurmukhi: sr isj rUpM ] sB Bt BUpM ] Aiq Cb soBM ] mun gn loBM ]157]
transliteration: Sar Sij Roopan|| Sabh Bhat Bhoopan|| At (i) Chhah Sobhan|| Mounndgad Lobhan||157||
translation: O Lord ! Thou art the king of kings, most beautiful like lotus, extremely glorious and manifestation of the desire of the mind of the sages.157.

gurmukhi: kr Ar DrmM ] prhr krmM ] Gr Gr vIrM ] prhr DIrM ]158]
transliteration: Kar Ar Dharamannd|| Par-har Karamannd|| Ghar Ghar Vderan|| Par-har Dhderan||158||
translation: Forsaking good action, all will accept the enemyâ€™s dharma and abandoning the forbearance, there will be sinful actions in every home.158.
